Article.Naam: Suspected Patient Malingering and Fraudulent Practitioner Claims

Question.Question: 1: Malingering is the unintentional production of false physical or physiological symptoms for a reward.
2: In malingering, a vigilant clinician may notice inconsistency between the patient’s verbal complaint and physical observations.
3: In the doctor-patient diagnostic interview, the more prolonged the interview, the more difficult it will be for the malingerer to maintain a false account.
4: Health-care fraud is the main reason for health-care cost inflation.
5: Once fraud has been established, there will be civil action and referral to the HPCSA for disciplinary action against the health-care professional.
